alert.note: Alert for Gila River Valley; Kofa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 06 at 12:47PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern La Paz and central Yuma Counties through 130 PM MST... At 1247 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southeast of Yuma Proving Ground, or 16 miles east of Martinez Lake, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern La Paz and central Yuma Counties. This includes AZ Route 95 between mile markers 49 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
